title: Deuterostome
summary: Deuterostomia /ˈdjuːtəroʊstoʊmiə/ (lit. 'second mouth' in Greek)[2][3] are animals typically characterized by their anus forming before their mouth during embryonic development. The group's sister clade is Protostomia, animals whose digestive tract development is more varied. Some examples of deuterostomes include vertebrates, sea stars, and crinoids.
